verses.roman:
ihā jāni' rāmadāsera duḥkha ha-ila mane
tabe ta' bhrātāre āmi karinu bhartsane

synonyms: ihā—this; jāni'-knowing; rāma-dāsera—of the saint Rāmadāsa; duḥkha—unhappiness; ha-ila—there was; mane—in the mind; tabe—at that time; ta'-certainly; bhrātāre—to my brother; āmi—I; karinu—did; bhartsane—chastisement.
translation: Knowing this, Śrī Rāmadāsa felt unhappy in his mind. I then rebuked my brother.
